front.p: 1862 November 14: to Gisborne Archives Ref No. IA1 242; 1863/2384.

body.p:
W. Gisborne, Esq,
Under Secretary,
Auckland.

I have the honor to acknowledge the reipt of your letter dated 6 November 1862 with Enclosure (for which I thank the Hon. Mr. Dillon Bell); and I greatly regret that—having to leave (according to Official notification) on Monday next, the 17th. inst., for Petane and Te Wairoa Districts, to Inspect the Schools there, and from which tour I shall not return before the 29th. inst.,—I shall not be ably to reply to your letter until after my return from my visit of School Inspection.—

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your mo. ob. servt.
Wm. Colenso.
